block.p: The General Dynamics Corporation will lay off 700 aerospace engineers in Fort Worth, a company spokesman said. It is the first big white-collar layoff at General Dynamics' Fort Worth division, which builds F-16 jets and researches other military projects.

The division has already laid off about 1,200 production workers this year. The new layoffs are necessary because the Air Force reduced orders for F-16's, the spokesman said. The company, based in St. Louis, expects to deliver about 150 F-16's in 1990, down from 180 in 1989.
